fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.themes

Interface ITemplateSystem


  • @SystemService
 @PluginService
public interface ITemplateSystem
    Provides and manages a specific type of templates, using a specific type of technology.

    Template packs for all template systems are stored in the theme assets folder, either as unpacked directories or as packed ZIP files. Names of items in ZIP files are assumed to be UTF-8 encoded, so take care with certain packaging tools when using accents on letters (UTF-8 is not always the default with other tools).

    Some template systems may be able to inject extra functionality into templates. Extra functionality can be provided by registering OSGi services using the interfaces ITemplateFunction and/or IHttpTemplateFunction (the latter being designed specifically for - and therefore restricted to - processing HTTP content).

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent read/write access.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

        String getName()
        Gets the locale-independent technical name used to refer to the template system.
        Returns:
        the non-null, non-empty name for the template system, which should be unique.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getTemplatePackages

      • getFileSystemDriver

        IFileSystemDriver getFileSystemDriver()
        Gets the driver for the virtual filesystem used for organizing and referring to the content of this template system, including package contents.

        The structure of the virtual filesystem must be compatible with the structure specified by IThemeService.getThemeFileSystem().

        Returns:
        the non-null filesystem driver.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isModifiable

        boolean isModifiable()
        Indicates whether or not this template system is modifiable. Modifiable template systems accept uploads for template packages.
        Returns:
        true if the template system is modifiable.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        UnsupportedThemeOperationException

      • addTemplatePackage

        void addTemplatePackage(String packageName)
                 throws IOException,
                        UnsupportedThemePackageException
        Requests that this template system should attempt to provide the named package using appropriate resources. After successful registration, the named package should be available using getTemplatePackages() and getTemplatePackage(String).

        The package name should be used to search for either a directory or a packed file in the theme assets folder (packed files are assumed to be in ZIP format: the ".zip" filename extension should therefore not be included in the supplied packageName parameter).

        The template system must be modifiable; if not, this method will throw an exception.

        Parameters:
        packageName - identifies the package. Must be non-null and non-empty.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the package cannot be read.
        UnsupportedThemePackageException - if the contents of the package are not in a format that can be understood by this template system.
        UnsupportedThemeOperationException - if the package cannot be added due to the template system being unmodifiable, or if the operation fails due to the bundle providing the service being stopped.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the package name is null or empty.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        addTemplatePackage(String, java.io.InputStream), IThemeService.attachTemplatePackage(String, String)

      • addTemplatePackage

        void addTemplatePackage(String packageName,
                        InputStream stream)
                 throws IOException,
                        UnsupportedThemePackageException
        Requests that this template system should attempt to import the named package using the supplied input stream. After successful registration, the named package should be available using getTemplatePackages() and getTemplatePackage(String).

        This template system must be modifiable; if not, this method will throw an exception.

        When a template package is registered in this way, the template system should also register persistent attachment of the package with the IThemeService.

        Note: to avoid race conditions in your code, typically at startup when calling this method after detecting the available of the template system using a ServiceTracker, consider calling IThemeService.isAssetDefined(String) first. Such race conditions may occur in bundles that try to install packages on startup without proper cleanup after being used previously.

        Parameters:
        packageName - identifies the package. Must be non-null and non-empty.
        stream - source for reading the package. The template system should always close the stream before returning or throwing an exception.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the package cannot be read.
        UnsupportedThemePackageException - if the contents of the package are not in a format that can be understood by this template system. The input stream should normally contain a ZIP archive.
        UnsupportedThemeOperationException - if the package cannot be added due to the template system being unmodifiable, or if the operation fails due to the bundle providing the service being stopped.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the package name is null or empty.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        addTemplatePackage(String), IThemeService.attachTemplatePackage(String, String), IPackage.exportPackage(java.io.OutputStream)

      • removeTemplatePackage

        void removeTemplatePackage(String packageName)
        Unregisters a template package from this template system, without deleting any files. The template system must be modifiable; if not, this method will throw an exception. The template system should not delete the files of the package.
        Parameters:
        packageName - identifies the package. Must be non-null and non-empty.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedThemeOperationException - if the package cannot be removed due to the template system being unmodifiable, or if the operation fails due to the bundle providing the service being stopped.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the package name is null or empty.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IThemeService.dropTemplatePackage(String), IThemeService.detachTemplatePackage(String)

      • getTemplate

        default ITemplateFile getTemplate(UUID attachId)
        Gets a template file using its unique attachment ID. All template packages associated with this template system will be searched.
        Parameters:
        attachId - the non-null attachment ID.
        Returns:
        the matching template, or null if no match can currently be found.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IAttachable.getAttachId()

      • getStyleSheet

        default IStyleSheet getStyleSheet(UUID attachId)
        Gets a stylesheet using its unique attachment ID. All style packages in all template packages associated with this template system will be searched.
        Parameters:
        attachId - the non-null attachment ID.
        Returns:
        the matching stylesheet, or null if no match can currently be found.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IAttachable.getAttachId()
